content.description:
This is a great route with good climbing the whole way. The layback in the upper half of the route presents a fun challenge. It is still a bit dirty but will clean up nicely with traffic.

Beware of loose blocks at the top of the route.
content.location:
It is in the middle of the Wind Tunnel on the eastern wall. Belay from either the big blocky middle of the Wind Tunnel (recommended) or down below on the grassy patch. This route shares an anchor with

Elliptic Lift

(5.10d) to the right.

content.description:
Start on the grassy ledge below the blocky belay ledge, and climb up to a ledge followed by enjoyable climbing up the face to the anchors shared with

Laminar Flow

.

This route (and others in this area) are still quite dirty, so helmets are highly recommended, as holds have been known to break off periodically.
content.location: Located on the eastern wall of the Wind Tunnel, it is the leftmost route that starts from the grassy belay spot below the blocky belay ledge.

climbs.name: Call Me Chopper
climbs.fa: Paul Heyliger, Brian Parsons, Greg Hand

content.description: Climb a short traverse right on a rail below the first bolt (consider stickclipping), then layback/pinch the arete feature to a leftward, diagonal seam. Find the chickenhead, and go for it - the bolt is at your waist. Pull up onto a patina slab above to the anchors. Beware, some of the patina is loose/broken.
content.location: It is on the Southern part of the Wind Tunnel. The easiest approach is to hike as if going to Private Idaho area, then take hard right up gully towards the Wind Tunnel. Start below an arete/seam diagonally arching up and left.

content.description: This is a very short, easy climb up the eastern wall of the Wind Tunnel. There is no real crux, just easy climbing the whole way. It is a bit dirty like most routes in this area but will clean up nicely with traffic.
content.location: Start on the large blocky belay ledge in the middle of the wind tunnel, and climb up to a large ledge, then follow 4 bolts to the low anchors.

climbs.name: Bernoulli's Bulge
climbs.fa: John Durkin, Paul Heyliger, Brian Parsons, Rob Bauer

content.description:
Climb a Voo-type start onto the face above - be careful of ledgefall potential after climbing above the 3rd bolt. Follow bolts through fun slab to the final headwall. The anchors are set back a little ways, so it may be better to rap when cleaning your gear off the anchors.

You get a good view of Devil's Gate proper and the entire surrounding area from the anchors. It has shared anchors with the Irrational - a .12b to the left.
content.location:
It is on the Southern part of the Wind Tunnel. It is easier to approach as if going to Private Idaho area then taking hard right (north) up gully towards the Wind Tunnel proper.

This route starts in shallow/wide chimney slot at a wide, right-facing corner.
